meanings.definition: A person who works with grease.
meanings.sent1: The greasers in the garage fix machines with grease.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic is a skilled greasers who keeps the engines running smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The greasers had a grease fight at the auto shop.
meanings.sent4: His hands were like greasers, always ready to get dirty and fix things.
meanings.sent5: The greasers at the workshop were covered in grease from head to toe.

meanings.definition: A member of a subculture characterized by greased-back hair and leather jackets.
meanings.sent1: The greasers in the movie had slicked-back hair and cool leather jackets.
meanings.sent2: She dressed up as a greasers for the 1950s themed party.
meanings.sent3: The greasers at the party were the coolest looking group.
meanings.sent4: He felt like a greasers with his new leather jacket and styled hair.
meanings.sent5: The greasers rode their motorcycles through the town, turning heads with their style.

meanings.definition: A device for applying grease to a surface.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used a greasers to lubricate the gears.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new greasers to maintain her bicycle.
meanings.sent3: The greasers was a handy tool for keeping things well-oiled.
meanings.sent4: He applied grease effortlessly with the greasers, making the job quick and easy.
meanings.sent5: The greasers was a lifesaver when it came to greasing the squeaky door hinges.
